properties.description: Each element represents the current symbol shown on a wheel; symbols are from a set of size n and each wheel is a cyclic permutation of the same symbol list.

core_constraints.name: distinct_symbols_feedback
core_constraints.description: After each action, the judge provides k = number of distinct symbols currently visible. This is the only observable feedback (assumed as core constraint due to interaction model).

core_constraints.name: action_limit
core_constraints.description: At most 10000 actions allowed (assumed as core constraint from problem statement).

core_constraints.name: non_adversarial_judge
core_constraints.description: The initial configuration is fixed and not adaptive (assumed as core constraint to ensure solvability).

objective.description: Determine a sequence of wheel rotations such that all wheels eventually show the same symbol (i.e., k = 1), using only feedback on distinct symbol count.

invariant.name: symbol_equality_via_alignment
invariant.description: All wheels share the same cyclic symbol sequence; therefore, aligning any wheel to match another is always possible via rotation. The hidden state can be inferred indirectly through changes in distinct count feedback (assumed invariant enabling solution).
